class.name: UObject
class.explain: The base UO Object class
class.member: x coordinate
y coordinate
z coordinate
case-sensitive name of the realm
name string (for items use .desc for single-click text, this does not include suffix or formatting)
object type as defined in itemdesc.cfg
art id number
unique object identifier
color value (0 to 0xFFF)
facing or the object (meaningful for mobiles and light-emitting items) range 0-127
height of the graphic as defined in tiledata.mul
This is set when anything on the object changes, and cleared on world save
weight of the graphic as defined in tiledata.mul
MultiRef for the Multi the object is on
Set if a specific name is set, otherwise like itemdesc name false.
class.method: Returns an array of property name strings.
True if the derived class is the same as the passed class type (see uo.em for all constants)
Returns an unpacked script object (i.e. int,string,array,etc)
Sets a packable object to a property.
Erases the property named 'propname'.

method.returns: object, new value of member or error

class.method: Sets the built-in member 'membername' to 'value'. obj.set_member("name","Eric") is the same as obj.name := "Eric"

method.returns: object, value of member or error

class.method: Gets the value of the built-in member 'membername'. var objname := obj.get_member("name") is the same as var objname := obj.name

class.name: Item
class.explain: Represents a physical item in the world.

equipment layer
item contained in
double-click action script. set to empty string for itemdesc.cfg default script.

script run when item unequipped

true if player may move the item
true if the item is invisible
game clock value after which this item might decay. 0=do not decay
Amount of gold an NPC sells this item for. 0=not for sale, -1=itemdesc default.
Amount of gold an NPC buys this item for. 0=not for sale, -1=itemdesc default.
true if the item remains with the ghost when player dies
like newbie, but it gets reset to 0 whenever it saves an item from dropping
true if item is cursed; does not have any special core handling other than preventing cursed and non-cursed items from stacking together.
number of items in container including the container itself (1 if this item is not a container or an empty container)
return is based on POL Decided stackability of item.
returns the Layer setting in the Tiles.cfg/Tiledata

Total of base property plus mod, applied to characters when equipt. Swing Speed Increase is used as a % modifier to the calculated speed of a weapon, e.g. Weapon speed of 30 * swing speed increase of 100% would make the swing speed 60.

Multiplicative modifier when calculating an item's weight. For example, on an item that weighs 100 stone, setting this property to 0.5 would have the item weigh 50 stone.
Returns Character that owns the item, ie. the character whose backpack or equipped items contains the item.
double-click action script when owned by another character. set to empty string for itemdesc.cfg default script.

Will split the item into 2 stacks. Returns a reference to the new stack made from item. Places new stack into the container

class.name: Character

class.member: 1 if in warmode
movemode string {default 'L'} like from NPCDesc.cfg
0=male 1=female
original objtype
original color
Armor factor modifier
Total AOS+ armor factor. If it's an NPC without armor equipped, it will return its intrinsic armor value taken from NpcDesc AR entry.
Total AOS+ armor factor. If it's an NPC without armor equipped, it will return its intrinsic armor value taken from NpcDesc AR entry.
Total AOS+ armor factor. If it's an NPC without armor equipped, it will return its intrinsic armor value taken from NpcDesc AR entry.

AOS+ Armor factor modifier (Player)
AOS+ Armor factor modifier (Player)
AOS+ Armor factor modifier (Player)
AOS+ Armor factor modifier (Player)
1 = normal players cannot see
concealed below this value cannot see
1 = player is frozen (by a GM)
1 = player is paralyzed
1 = player is poisoned, just makes the health bar green or not
number of walk steps left until player is revealed
number of steps taken while character was mounted
1 = player cannot speak
1 = player is dead

Reference to character's pack (if any)
Reference to character they are trading with (if any)
Reference to the trade container if the char has an active trade, error if no active trade

Account Reference (if not NPC) (deprecated, will be removed in next release, use Client instead)
Account name string (if not NPC)
command level of character
string name of command level
1 = player is temporally criminal (gray) or murderer (red) (see also temporally_criminal)
1 = player is temporally criminal (gray) (see also criminal)
IP Address string (deprecated, will be removed in next release, use Client instead)
True if the client has an active target cursor
True if the client has any active gumps from SendGump
True if the client has any active String or Unicode prompt windows
Amount of gold in character's pack
String placed before name i.e. Lord Racalac
String placed after name i.e. Racalac the Brave

guild ID number
guild object reference
1 = player flagged murderer (red)
Script reference for attached script
(reputation system) Array of Structs: { serial, killer, gameclock }, serial = killer's serial, killer = 'offline mobile reference' to the killer, gameclock = game time when the death occurred
UO Client version string
UO Client information struct (check out core-changes.txt for an example) (deprecated, will be removed in next release, use Client instead)
UO Client version string as Struct of Ints {major;minor;rev;patch} (deprecated, will be removed in next release, use Client instead)
Weapon Delay modifier, milliseconds
PolClock when character was created
Mobile reference if a combat opponent is selected.
To determine if the character is actively connected to the game. Is set to 1 before logon/reconnect scripts are run and 0 right before logofftest is run. Will return 1 on NPC.
Reports the Unicode Language string client sends during logon.

Set/get the ML/SA race (new constants in UO.EM: RACE_HUMAN, RACE_ELF,RACE_GARGOYLE). You have to set visual graphic by yourself if you change value (Human male/female = 0x190/0x191 / Elf male/female = 0x25d/0x25e / Gargoyle male/female = 0x029a/0x029b). You can choose Race at Char creation if your UOExpansion and UOFeature settings fit.
Additive modificator of the hitchance from the attacker (+- int in thousandth)
Subtractive modificator of the hitchance from the defender (+- int in thousandth)
Additive modificator of the parry_chance from the defender (+- int in thousandth)

Current carrying capacity. Defined as (40 + 3.5*chr.strength + chr.carrying_capacity_mod)*ssopt.carrying_capacity_mod. Note that characters can go above their carrying capacity, but will run out of stamina much faster.
Carrying capacity modifier. Is taken into account prior to global ssopt modifier.
AOS+ Statcap entry in statusbar, default 255
This is for storage of overall skillcap, default 700
Max followers for statmsg packet, default 0
This is for storage for the Followers byte in statmsg packet, default 0
Tithing for statmsg packet, default 0

Returns the current active buffs added via addBuff as dictionary. Key is the iconid and value a struct struct{name_cliloc, desc_cliloc, end_time, name_args, desc_args}.
class.method: sets the character poisoned, controller of calling script is flagged as in repsystem
sets the character paralyzed, controller of calling script is flagged as in repsystem
sets the character criminal. level multiplies the CriminalFlagInterval as defined in repsys.cfg. level=0 clears criminal timer.
sets the light level of the character to 'level' for 'duration' seconds
character cannot talk for 'duration' seconds. -1 means forever. 0 clears the squelch
enables the 'granted' privilege to the character
disables the 'granted' privilege to the character
true if the privilege is enabled
Dictionary where keys are privilege name, value is 0/1 boolean.
grants the command level to the char as defined in cmds.cfg
if enough gold, removes it from the player's pack
flags the character as a murderer (red)
removes the killer with 'serial' from the reportables list that was added at 'gameclock'
returns an ItemRef to the item held on the player's cursor, if any.
Returns 'dragged' item to original location.
Sets the internal warmode flag and sends the update to the player. Returns the new warmode value.
Returns an item reference to the most recent corpse made.
Attacks once without modifing the swingtimer. If no opp is given attacks current attackable opponent, else attacks given opponent (but checks if still attackable)
If opponent is set sets swingtimer to given ms time.
Kills character ignoring invul, if killer is set repsys:OnDamage is called
Sets Facing to given direction. If FACE_FORCE is set frozen/paralysed is not checked
true if Client Version >= given Versionstring
sets aggressor for repsys.cfg:AggressorFlagTimeout seconds for given chr
sets lawfullydamaged for repsys.cfg:AggressorFlagTimeout seconds for given chr
clears aggressor entry for given chr
clears lawfullydamaged entry for given chr
character cannot hear for 'duration' seconds. -1 means forever. 0 clears the deaf
Used to send the Season packet 0xBC to a single character, doesnt resend the lightlevel or weather.

method.proto: addBuff(int icon_id, int duration, int cliloc_name, int cliloc_descr, string arguments_desc, [string arguments_name])

class.method: Adds a buff to Character's buff bar. Duration is in seconds: countdown is done by the client, but the icon is never automatically removed. Arguments is an Unicode string; separated by a single tab character. Example: who.addBuff(1029, 30, 1075814, 1075815, "1234 5678"); Optional arguments_name parameters needs a client higher then 5.x and modifies the cliloc_name.
Removes all buffs from Character's buff bar.
Removes a buff from Character's buff bar.
Disables skill scripts for given seconds

class.name: NPC
class.explain: A Non-Player Character mobile object
class.member: NPC template alignment.
NPC template name in npcdesc.cfg
controlling player character, false if none
Control script reference, error on none
bitwise-ORd list of sysevents that have been enabled, error if no control script running
NPC speech text color
NPC speech text font
control script name
Use movement adjustments to avoid single-tile obsticals
NPC walk delay (maximum 250)
default 1, if you set this to 0 the npc and all items contained within it's wornitems container will NOT be saved to datafile
defines if npc is a valid target even if no_drop is set for the item
class.method: Sets the master character for the NPC, if not passed, clears master.

Array of Character References on the deck
true if players are logged out on the deck
ItemRef to the tillerman item
ItemRef to the left-side plank item
ItemRef to the right-side plank item

array of ItemRefs of all the rope components on the boat, or empty array if none

array of ItemRefs of all the components on the boat
id for this kind of multi
pilot of boat (if any)

method.proto: move_offline_mobiles(int x, int y, int z[, string realm])

class.method: moves offline mobiles on boat to x,y,z. If realm is not set, Boat-realm is used.

Sets the boat pilot to the provided character; removes pilot if 0 is passed. Mouse movements from the boat's pilot will be sent to the boat's control script. See event SYSEVENT_BOAT_MOVEMENT for more details. Possible errors: The boat is already being piloted; The boat does not have a running process; That character is not connected; The boat does not have that character on it; The boat mount piece is not equippable by that character; The client for that character does not support High Seas Adventure

Used to change a boat's multi to an alternative multi defined in its itemdesc file. Alternate ids are referenced with an integer based on the order they are defined in the itemdesc file starting from 1, with the base multi id being 0.

class.name: House
class.explain: A Multi object where players hoard items.
class.member: Array of House components, i.e. sign, doors
Array of Item References in the house
Array of Character References in the house
1 = custom house
1 if the house is currently being edited
id for this kind of multi
returns array of structs{graphic,xoffset,yoffset,z} or error if not a custom house. When in edit mode returns the current working design. To get the real coords from an elem add house.x/y
class.method: Sets the house as custom. Setting to 1 is needed before SendHousingTool() works.
Add item to House components
Erase item from House components

method.proto: addhousepart(int graphic, int xoffset, int yoffset, int z)

class.method: Adds a part to the custom house design.

method.proto: erasehousepart(int graphic, int xoffset, int yoffset, int z)

class.method: Removes a part from the custom house design.
If commit is 0 then drops the not committed custom house changes or accept them instead
Stops editing mode. If drop_changes is true, drops all non committed changes

Set the multi's multiid, changing its shape. If name is passed, will use the MultiID as defined by that item descriptor. Uses the same flags as CreateMultiAtLocation() and can return the same errors. To either keep or recreate the components (eg. doors, house signs, ...), pass either CRMULTI_KEEP_COMPONENTS or CRMULTI_RECREATE_COMPONENTS respectively. See module function CreateMultiAtLocation in uo.em for more information.

class.name: Door
class.explain: A door item that automatically closes.
class.member: true if the door is open
class.method: opens the door
closes the door
toggles the door to the other state

class.name: Account
class.explain: Object describing a player's game account
class.member: the name of the account
true if enabled
true if banned
MD5 username+password hash string
used uo-expansion
the number for the accounts default command level
class.method: If Index is 0 (.AddCharacter(0)), it will find the next available slot on the account. (Otherwise pass 1-5) Will create a naked, uncolored, male character named 'new character' at 1, 1, 1 on Britannia. No scripts are ran for this method of character creation. Edit this new character via the script creating it.
bans the account
unbans the account
enables the account
disables the account
sets the account password to newpass
returns true if 'pass' is the account's password
sets the account name to newname, password to newpass. The parameter newpass is only optional if you have clear text passwords (RetainCleartextPasswords) - which you shouldn't.
gets an OfflineCharacterRef for the character in slot 'slot'. returns error if not character in that slot (1..5)
Deletes character in slot 'slot'. returns error if not character in that slot (1..5)
Delete this empty account.
Create a new account and move character to it. On success returns a reference to the new account.
Move character from this account to destination account. You can use it to flip chars on same account too.
GetObjProperty for account objects.
SetObjProperty for account objects.
EraseObjProperty for account objects.
returns an array of cprop names on this account

This determines what flag is sent with packet 0xB9 during login (Nothing -> 0x0000 / T2A -> 0x0001 / LBR -> 0x0002 / AOS -> 0x801b / SE -> 0x805b / ML -> 0x80db / KR -> 0x86DB / SA -> 0x187DF / HSA -> 0x387DF / TOL -> 0x7387DF). It's possible to hook 0xB9 but don't forget to set_uo_expansion anyway because core uses this for internal flags (e.g. AoS Tooltips). The servspecopt.cfg UOFeatureEnable is used with packet 0xA9 and is currently global to all clients. Recognized values: TOL, HSA, SA, KR, ML, SE, AOS, LBR, T2A (default).
Set the account's default command level.

method.returns: object, value of member or error

class.method: Gets the value of the built-in member 'membername'. var objname := obj.get_member("name") is the same as var objname := obj.name" proto="get_member(string membername)" returns="object, value of member or error

class.name: Weapon
class.explain: Equipable items that deal damage in combat
class.member: Damage Modifier
from -32768 to 32767, an optional way to delay if you want to use the default speed math and just add to that
Attribute name this weapon uses as a skill
Script name that runs when weapon makes a hit

class.name: Container
class.explain: Items that can be locked, and have other items inside them
class.member: from -32768 to 32767, modifier for max items allowed in the container
from -32768 to 32767, modifier for max weight allowed in the container
from -32768 to 32767, modifier for max slots allowed in the container

Multiplicative modifier when calculating the container's held weight. For example, on an backpack (having weight 3 stones) that contains items totalling a weight of 100 stone, setting this property to 0.5 would have the backpack weigh 53 (3 + 100 * 0.5) stone.
defines if npc is a valid target even if no_drop is set for the item

struct of arrays of structs - iostats["sent"array->256 elements of struct["count","bytes"],"received"array->256 elements of struct["count","bytes"]]

returns and array of info structures about packets currently in the queue

inserts a new object into the array at index
erases index to end of array
inserts object in the end of the array
reverses the elements of the array
sorts the elements of the array, or if sub_index is given sorts array of arrays using the given index for sorting
concatinates 2 arrays
returns random array entry
will move array [count] steps backwards or forwards in-place as it were a conveyor belt. {1, 2, 3}.cycle() Will make it: {3, 1, 2}. Accepts a negative value as a shift to move different direction
Inserts obj into already sorted array. sub_index and reverse parameter have to match the sorting criteria of the array.

Returns a new array containing just the elements that pass the test function. If no elements pass the test, an empty array is returned.
testFn is a function that can accept up to three parameters:
element: The current element being processed
index: The index of the current element being processed
array: The array filter() was called upon

Returns the first element in the provided array that satisfies the provided testing function. If no elements satisfy the testing function, <uninitialized object> is returned.
testFn is a function that can accept up to three parameters:
element: The current element being processed
index: The index of the current element being processed
array: The array find() was called upon

Returns the index of the first element in an array that satisfies the provided testing function. If no elements satisfy the testing function, 0 is returned.
testFn is a function that can accept up to three parameters:
element: The current element being processed
index: The index of the current element being processed
array: The array findIndex() was called upon

Returns a new array populated with the results of calling a provided mapping function on every element in the calling array.
mapFn is a function that can accept up to three parameters:
element: The current element being processed
index: The index of the current element being processed
array: The array map() was called upon

Executes a user-supplied reducer callback function on each element of the array, in order, passing in the return value from the calculation on the preceding element. The final result of running the reducer across all elements of the array is a single value. The first time that the callback is run there is no 'return value of the previous calculation'. If supplied, an initial value may be used in its place. Otherwise the array element at index 1 is used as the initial value and iteration starts from the next element (index 2 instead of index 1).
reducerFn is a function that can accept up to four parameters:
accumulator: The value resulting from the previous call to reducerFn. On the first call, its value is initialValue if the latter is specified; otherwise its value is array[1]
currentValue: The value of the current element. On the first call, its value is array[1] if initialValue is specified; otherwise its value is array[2].
currentIndex: The index position of currentValue in the array. On the first call, its value is 1 if initialValue is specified, otherwise 2.
array: The array reduce() was called upon
For additional examples and discussions, see Racalac's Escript Guide.

class.name: AuxConnection
class.explain: An object passed to an Aux Service Script that allows the script to transmit and recieve packed data over a TCP/IP port. use wait_for_event() in the service script to recieve data.
class.member: Originating IP on the AuxConnection Pipe
class.method: Transmits the packable object 'o' over the Aux connection. If the connection script has the AUXSVC_ASSUME_STRING script option, then the parameter object o is sent as a string and not unpacked. If the Aux Connection was created with the ignore_line_breaks option, then a CRLF will not be appended to the message.

class.name: Error
class.member: Informational Error string

class.name: String
class.explain: An ordered collection of ascii (1-byte) characters. Declare and pre-initialize with var s := "my string"
class.method: 'Substring': returns a new string from the character range between start and length, inclusive. Returns error if index out of range. Ex: var str := "yomama"; str[2,3] would return "oma".
seaches the string for 'substr'. If found, returns the first character of the substring, else uninitialized object.
finds the first occurance of 'substr' and replaces substr with 'replace_str'. returns the new string.
concatenates the strings, returns the new string.
returns number of characters in the string

returns like Find(string, search, start) the index of the first occurance of 'search' after 'start' within str, but unlike the basic.em function the Start parameter is optional if not given it searches the whole string
returns like upper(str) the uppercase version and also modifies the str
returns like lower(str) the lowercase version and also modifies the str

formats a string using the data from args.
Accepts the following format:
{:x} for hex representation
{:o} for octal
{:b} for binary
Add a # to get notation prefix, e.g.:
"{:x}".format(10) -> "a"
"{:#x}".format(10) -> "0xa"
Parameters can be simple:
"You have {} gold coins".format(120) -> "You have 120 gold coins"
and are unpacked implicitly by their order:
"{} hits {} for {} of damage".format("John", "Bob", 120) -> "John hits Bob for 120 of damage"
However you can specify parameters explicitly (first argument is at 1):
"You hit {2} for {1} damage".format(120, "John Doe") -> "You hit John Doe for 120 damage"
Format allows accessing object members:
"Spell {1.spell_name} requires reagents: {1.reagents}".format(struct{spell_name:="Fire Wrath", "Ba, Bm, Ga"}) -> "Spell Fire Wrath requires reagents: Ba, Bm, Ga"
Implicit members also work:
"{name} you hit level {level}".format(struct{name:="Jane Doe", level:=4}) -> "Jane Doe you hit level 4"
Character or item members are accessed the same way:
"{1.name}, your shield {2.desc} has {2.hp} hp".format(who, who.shield) -> "Admin, your shield Buckler of Death has 150 hp"
returns a string which is the concatenation of the array elements, seperated by str

class.name: Struct
class.method: if exists, returns count of matching key
number of keys in the struct
inserts a new object into the struct for key. Returns size.
returns an array of the keys
struct.+member adds a member
gets value of member
gets value of member ONLY when member is a string! no using integers here like an array.
removes given key
struct.-member removes a member
struct.?member returns count of matching member

class.name: Package
class.explain: Object representing a package in the system
class.member: Package name
Package version
Does the Package supports www?
Does the Package hold an own npcdesc.cfg?
Package directory path
name + directory

class.name: Packet
class.explain: Object representing a binary packet. Print(Packet) returns string of Packet contents.
Packets that are pre-character selection will now report a struct to a packethook with the member "ip"
class.method: Sends this packet to character.

method.proto: SendAreaPacket(int x, int y, int range, string realm)

class.method: Sends this packet to all the players in range of x,y. Returns integer number of clients this packet was successfully sent to.
Returns size of packet data in bytes.
Gets 8-bit (1 byte) value at offset (0-based).
Gets 16-bit (2 byte) value at offset (0-based). Automatically converts to Big-Endian.
Gets 32-bit (4 byte) value at offset (0-based). Automatically converts to Big-Endian.
Gets 16-bit (2 byte) value at offset (0-based). Automatically converts to Low-Endian.
Gets 32-bit (4 byte) value at offset (0-based). Automatically converts to Low-Endian.
Gets a string (1-byte characters) at offset (0-based) for length characters.
Gets a 'unicode string' (2-byte characters) at offset (0-based) for length characters (NOT BYTES).
Gets a 'unicode string' (2-byte characters) at offset (0-based) for length characters (NOT BYTES). With Flipped Byte Order (for specific packet support)

Sets the new size of the packet, possibly destroying data if packet size was decreased. Updates the encoded size for variable length packets, not allowed for fixed-length packets. Returns the old size of the packet.

Sets an 8-bit (1-byte) value at offset (0-based). If offset is greater than current size, the packet is resized to fit the new data and the encoded size is updated for variable length packets. Resizing is not allowed for fixed-length packets.

Sets an 16-bit (2-byte) value at offset (0-based). If offset is greater than current size, the packet is resized to fit the new data and the encoded size is updated for variable length packets. Resizing is not allowed for fixed-length packets. Automatically converts to Big-Endian.

Sets an 32-bit (4-byte) value at offset (0-based). If offset is greater than current size, the packet is resized to fit the new data and the encoded size is updated for variable length packets. Resizing is not allowed for fixed-length packets. Automatically converts to Big-Endian. NOTE: currently there's a compiler problem setting 0xFFFFFFFF, it gets converted to 0x7FFFFFFF. Use multiple SetInt16 or SetInt8 calls for now.

Sets an 16-bit (2-byte) value at offset (0-based). If offset is greater than current size, the packet is resized to fit the new data and the encoded size is updated for variable length packets. Resizing is not allowed for fixed-length packets. Automatically converts to Low-Endian.

Sets an 32-bit (4-byte) value at offset (0-based). If offset is greater than current size, the packet is resized to fit the new data and the encoded size is updated for variable length packets. Resizing is not allowed for fixed-length packets. Automatically converts to Low-Endian. NOTE: currently there's a compiler problem setting 0xFFFFFFFF, it gets converted to 0x7FFFFFFF. Use multiple SetInt16 or SetInt8 calls for now.

method.proto: SetString(int offset, string string, int nullterminate)

class.method: Sets a string value at offset (0-based). If offset plus length of string is greater than current size, the packet is resized to fit the new data and the encoded size is updated for variable length packets. Resizing is not allowed for fixed-length packets. Set nullterminate to 1 if you want to automatically append a 0 terminator.

method.proto: SetUnicodeString(int offset, array unicode character, int nullterminate)

class.method: Sets a unicode string at offset (0-based). If offset plus length of string (2*number of members in the array) is greater than current size, the packet is resized to fit the new data and the encoded size is updated for variable length packets. Resizing is not allowed for fixed-length packets. Set nullterminate to 1 if you want to automatically append a double 0 terminator. Unicode strings in eScript are arrays of 2-byte values. See unicode.em for useful functions. CAscZ in basic.em is useful for character sets that use the ascii/ansi standard.

method.proto: SetUnicodeStringFlipped(int offset, array unicode character, int nullterminate)

class.method: Sets a unicode string at offset (0-based). If offset plus length of string (2*number of members in the array) is greater than current size, the packet is resized to fit the new data and the encoded size is updated for variable length packets. Resizing is not allowed for fixed-length packets. Set nullterminate to 1 if you want to automatically append a double 0 terminator. Unicode strings in eScript are arrays of 2-byte values. See unicode.em for useful functions. CAscZ in basic.em is useful for character sets that use the ascii/ansi standard. With Flipped Byte Order (for specific packet support)

method.proto: SetUtf8String(int offset, string string, int nullterminate)

class.method: Sets a UTF-8 encoded string value at offset (0-based). If offset plus length of string is greater than current size, the packet is resized to fit the new data and the encoded size is updated for variable length packets. Resizing is not allowed for fixed-length packets. Set nullterminate to 1 if you want to automatically append a 0 terminator.

Adds a character to the party as candidate.

Removes a character candidate.
Returns an unpacked script object (i.e. int,string,array,etc).
Sets a packable object to a property.
Erases the property named 'propname'.
Returns an array of property name strings.

class.name: BinaryFile

class.method: Closes the underlying stream.
Returns filesize in bytes.
Seeks to position. See file.em constants for seekdir
Returns current position.
Reads and returns the next byte without extracting it (-1 if eof is reached).
Writes all unwritten chars from buffer to file.
Gets unsigned 8-bit (1 byte) value.
Gets unsigned 16-bit (2 byte) value.
Gets unsigned 32-bit (4 byte) value.
Gets signed 8-bit (1 byte) value.
Gets signed 16-bit (2 byte) value.
Gets signed 32-bit (4 byte) value.
Gets a string (1-byte characters) for length characters.
Sets unsigned 8-bit (1 byte) value.
Sets unsigned 16-bit (2 byte) value.
Sets unsigned 32-bit (4 byte) value.
Sets signed 8-bit (1 byte) value.
Sets signed 16-bit (2 byte) value.
Sets signed 32-bit (4 byte) value.
Sets a string. Set nullterminate to 1 if you want to automatically append a 0 terminator.

class.name: Spellbook
class.explain: Object representing a Spellbook.
class.method: Removes given spellid.
Adds given spellid.
Returns array of SpellIDs
Checks if given spellid is inside the spellbook.

class.name: ClassInstanceRef
class.explain: A reference to an Escript class instance, created via calling a class constructor via ClassName() or @ClassName.new(). A class instance behaves similarly like a Struct, and can have string members attached to it.
class.method: add member
gets value of member
gets value of member ONLY when member is a string
removes a member
returns count of matching member
A class instance has methods for each instance method defined for the class. See the Escript guide for more information.

class.name: Client
class.explain: Object representing a connected client. The ClientRef is important when having packethooks which are active before characters are selected, when you only have access to the Client and not the Character. Because the ClientRef contains most information that was in the Character before, it becomes redundant to have those methods and properties in the Character and they will be removed in a future release.
class.member: Account name string
Account reference
IP Address string
connected listen port
UO Client version string
UO Client information struct (check out core-changes.txt for an example)
UO Client version string as Struct of Ints {major;minor;rev;patch}
client send expansion info flag
clientversion type bitfield
POL clock when last activity has been made
POL clock when last packet has been received
If true, client will not be disconnected due to inactivity.
class.method: true if Client Version >= given Versionstring

class.name: StorageAreas
class.explain: Object representing a list of all storage areas. It is iterable: iterates over StorageArea objects. It supports the [] operator: its behavior is similar to FindStorageArea()
class.member: Number of storage areas

class.name: StorageArea
class.explain: Object representing a storage area. It is iterable: iterates over Item objects (root items in storage area).
class.member: Number of root items in this storage area
Number of items in this storage area

class.name: FunctionObject
class.explain: Object representing a function. Created via "var f:=@myfunc;" Object can be copied inside the same script, but cannot be stored in cprops or transfered to a different script.
class.method: Calls the underlying function, arguments and return value are the same as the original function.
Returns a new instance of a class whose constructor is this FunctionObject, calling the class constructor function with a new this instance.

class.name: Boolean
class.explain: Object representing a boolean value, only comparison operators ==, !=, ! are implemented. Can be stored in cprops/datafiles.

class.name: XMLFile
class.explain: Object representing a XML file. ForEach support: iterates over all child nodes, iterator is XMLNode object _iterator_iter is integer index.
class.method: removes node by index, first node with given name or passed one.

method.proto: setxmldeclaration(string version, string encoding, string standalone)

class.method: Sets the xml declaration.
Appends node with name value and given attributes (key=name, value=value).
Adds comment.
Saves to file.
Returns XML as string, identation is by default \t.
If key is integer returns node of given index, if key is a string returns first node with key as name.

class.name: XMLNode
class.explain: Object representing a XML node. ForEach support: iterates over all child nodes, iterator is XMLNode object _iterator_iter is integer index.
class.member: Returns attribute object of node.
Returns type string (XMLComment, XMLDeclaration, XMLDocument, XMLElement, XMLText, XMLTypeCount, XMLUnknown).
class.method: removes node by index, first node with given name or passed one.
Create a copy of node which is then valid longer then the file object.
Returns first children or first with given name.
Returns next sibling or first with given name.
Appends node with name value and given attributes (key=name, value=value).
Adds comment.
Sets node attributes (key=name, value=value).
Removes attribute with given name.
Adds node text.

class.name: XMLAttributes
class.explain: Object representing XML attributes of a node. ForEach support: iterates over all attributes, iterator is a struct with key=attributename and value=attributevalue, _iterator_iter is integer index.
class.method: Returns array of all attribute names.
Returns attribute value.

class.name: ExportedScript
class.explain: Object representing a script loaded via OS::LoadExportedScript(). The script will be alive as long as the object exists.
class.member: Returns names of all exported functions.
class.method: Calls the given function with the optional arguments and returns the function return value. Calling script will be blocked until the function returns and will be executed non-critical or critical depending on the calling script.
